Name: Hemingway
Ingredients: 12.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: SHAKE first 3 ingredients with ice and fine strain into chilled glass.
Review: Delicately sweetened lime and champagne with faint notes of aniseed from the absinthe.
History: A lime influenced riff on Ernest Hemingway 's classic Death in the Afternoon . Another version of this cocktail, apparently created at Cantineros' Club, the famous Cuban bar school, calls for a shot of Pernod anis to be poured into a chilled glass and then topped with champagne.
Nutrition: One serving of Hemingway contains 151 calories
Garnish: ¼ lime wheel slice on rim
